name: Lose a Letter Lexicon Ladder Part 8 Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Here's a playing tip - If you can't solve the first clue go to one of the others that you can solve, and then work up and down from there.

First word of six letters-

Humorous television series featuring a regular cast.
questions.explanation:
Sitcom.

	The term sitcom is a combination of the words SITuation and COMedy, and is thought to have been first coined in 1951.

questions.text:
Now drop one letter from the previous answer and rearrange the remaining letters to make the new word of five letters-

Slightly wet or damp.

Third word of four letters-

To leave out.
questions.explanation:
Omit.

	The word moist is from the Latin 'omittere' meaning against or away.

questions.text:
Fourth word of three letters-

Male cat.
questions.explanation:
Tom.

	The male turkey is also called a tom.

questions.text:
Fifth word of two letters-

Abbreviation of biblical Matthew.

New word of seven letters-

Division of a book.
questions.explanation:
Chapter.

	Chapter can also mean an historical period, or the local branch of an organisation.

questions.text:
Second word of six letters-

Heavy fabric floor covering.

Third word of five letters-

An extremely small amount.

Fourth word of four letters-

A unit of land area.
questions.explanation:
Acre.

	One acre is equal to 4,840 square yards.

questions.text:
Fifth word of three letters-

A period in time.
